channel.title: [help] Saving standard image in java?
channel.description:
I need to know how to save a standard image in java, to either one of the following formats: jpeg, png, bmp I know how to save renderedimages, but I can't work out how to convert from Image to RenderedImage =\
Any help would be appreciated greatly, thx ^^

item.title: [help] Saving standard image in java?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

Lol I tested and it works, but I got the wrong byte var to dump the interfaces with =\

Read full topic

item.title: [help] Saving standard image in java?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:2, topic:18581”]Here you go: ImageIO.write(RenderedImage im, String formatName, File output);

A rendered image has many implimentations, such as BufferedImage.

Here’s a quicky to get your image into a bufferedimage:

BufferedImage bi = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);
bi.getGraphics().drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
ImageIO.write(bi, "png", new File("root/image.png"));

lol and yes, i know this is a nigger way around it. There are more efficient ways, believe me.[/quote]

Heh thanks lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [help] Saving standard image in java?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Here you go: ImageIO.write(RenderedImage im, String formatName, File output);

A rendered image has many implimentations, such as BufferedImage.

Here’s a quicky to get your image into a bufferedimage:

BufferedImage bi = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);
bi.getGraphics().drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
ImageIO.write(bi, "png", new File("root/image.png"));

lol and yes, i know this is a nigger way around it. There are more efficient ways, believe me.

Read full topic
